poem:
**Without Pay**

In the stubborn shadow  
of a sunlit olive grove,  
voices thread through silence,  
a story of clenched fists—  
accounts unopened,  
words unspoken,  
yet they stand still  
fractured  
on unswept paths,  
grains of sand underfoot,  
waiting, like hearts,  
for wind  
to whisper change.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "This Palestinian human rights group was sanctioned by Trump. Its chief wishes US allies would take a stand Al-Haq, a leading Palestinian human rights organization based in the West Bank, is not new to adversity. But since the group was sanctioned by the Trump administration in September, its world has shrunk. Today, staff work without pay because their banks closed their accounts. US-based funders have pulled away. YouTube has pulled hundreds of the group’s videos". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
